examples: She placed a calendar on the wall to keep track of important dates.
We should mark the date on the calendar for our family gathering.
I need to check my calendar to see if I'm available on that date.
Here's a calendar.
Mark your calendars.
words.defineEn: a page or set of pages showing the days, weeks, and months of a particular year, especially one put on a wall
words.defineVi: một trang hoặc tập hợp các trang hiển thị ngày, tuần và tháng của một năm cụ thể, đặc biệt là trang được dán trên tường

examples: The twentieth century saw dramatic changes in most areas of life.
Mrs. Thatcher held the post of prime minister longer than anyone else last century.
The ancient castle has stood for over a century, preserving its grandeur and history for hundreds of years.
This charming cottage dates back to the 15th century and is as pretty as a picture, with its thatched roof and secluded garden.
In the early 20th century, a respected woman in high society dramatically came down in the world if she got divorced.
words.defineEn: a period of one hundred years
words.defineVi: khoảng thời gian một trăm năm

examples: After decades as an investigator, I can identify a con man a mile away.
He has reached the top by climbing the greasy pole for over a decade.
The Beatles are a band that have become a household name and whose music is still popular decades later.
A decade ago, Whitley became enamored of romance and gave writing a whirl.
My father had a living in an inner suburb of Leeds which had been going down in the world for decades.
words.defineEn: ten years of time
words.defineVi: mười năm thời gian

examples: Today is Monday.
The lawyers put another nail in her coffin today.
The euro hit a record low in trading today.
I saw a famous actress at the shopping mall today.
All winter coats are half-price today.
words.defineEn: on the present day not tomorrow or yesterday
words.defineVi: vào ngày hôm nay không phải ngày mai hay ngày hôm qua

examples: This young team is taking the veteran squad to the cleaners tonight.
The store will close at 9 p.m. tonight.
Tonight we have a delicious tofu stir-fry with fresh vegetables and a flavorful sauce.
The news won't be on tonight.
The restaurant reservation is for 8 o'clock tonight.
words.defineEn: on the night of today
words.defineVi: vào đêm hôm nay

examples: Temperatures hit 40° yesterday.
Yesterday he baked a loaf of whole wheat bread.
I handed in my notice yesterday.
I only started this book yesterday.
The battle lines were drawn yesterday for the fiercest contest in the history of local radio.
words.defineEn: on the day before the present day
words.defineVi: vào ngày trước ngày nay

examples: Give me a call tomorrow.
They're busting a move tomorrow.
We have to learn one of Hamlet's speeches for school tomorrow.
The charges against the suspect will come up in court tomorrow.
The President hits town tomorrow.
words.defineEn: the day after the present day
words.defineVi: ngày sau ngày hôm nay

examples: The railway line runs right past the house.
The clock says ten past two.
Not a single jot or tittle goes past the eye of the boss without her noticing.
The cat ran right past me and into the house.
His past comes back to hunt him when an old friend returns to his life.
words.defineEn: the time that has passed or gone by
words.defineVi: thời gian đã trôi qua hoặc trôi qua

examples: With the promotion, the company's future is now in his hands.
The country's future is balanced on a razor's edge.
The whole future of the project is still up in the air.
A question mark hangs over the future of the company.
If sales don't improve, the company might not have a future.
words.defineEn: the time that will come after the present or the events that will happen then
words.defineVi: thời gian sẽ đến sau hiện tại hoặc các sự kiện sẽ xảy ra sau đó

examples: Give me a moment, please.
Do you have a moment?
Keeping his shirt on during intense moments.
The upcoming election is a kill or cure moment for the future of the country.
Life is not exactly a barrel of laughs at the moment.
words.defineEn: a very short period of time
words.defineVi: một khoảng thời gian rất ngắn

examples: It’s only lunchtime
And Mr. Trump was given the lunchtime slot.
This next story starts in Bryant Park, Midtown New York, on a Tuesday lunchtime.
'Let's go out at lunchtime.
And there's another format that's more oriented towards prepared food that's kind of like a lunchtime spot.
words.defineEn: the time in the middle of the day when we eat lunch
words.defineVi: thời gian vào giữa ngày khi chúng tôi ăn trưa

examples: That holiday cost me a small fortune.
The closing of the airport knocked our holiday plans on the head.
I'll always remember this holiday.
My favorite month is December because of the holidays.
We sometimes visit our relatives during the holidays.
words.defineEn: a day or period of time fixed by law when we don't have to go to school or work
words.defineVi: một ngày hoặc khoảng thời gian được pháp luật ấn định khi chúng tôi không phải đi học hoặc đi làm

examples: She wears her hair long.
This policy is no longer an effective means to an end.
Our players kept the pedal to the metal all season long.
The kids are under my feet all day long.
North Korea’s refusal had long been a sticking point.
words.defineEn: for a great amount of time
words.defineVi: trong một khoảng thời gian dài

examples: Short hair really becomes you.
The boss has a short fuse these days!
She made short work of her opponents.
We fell short of our goal in the competition.
As they say, short reckonings make long friends.
words.defineEn: not lasting or taking a lot of time
words.defineVi: không kéo dài hoặc mất nhiều thời gian

examples: The library closes early on Sundays.
She sent the kids to bed early.
Her early research laid the foundation for many important medical discoveries.
Book early and save £50!
For some people, early morning jogging is their cup of tea.
words.defineEn: before the usual or expected time
words.defineVi: trước thời gian thông thường hoặc dự kiến

examples: Spring came late this year.
Her latest novel takes the lid off the international art world.
The government's latest proposals are a dog's dinner.
She was only five minutes late!
The latest smartphone is now on the market.
words.defineEn: after the usual or expected time
words.defineVi: sau thời gian bình thường hoặc dự kiến

examples: That man eats Ramen noodles daily for dinner but for his dog, he threw a big party.
The plants want watering daily.
The mother of two young children felt overwhelmed by her daily tasks, which included cooking, cleaning, and child-rearing.
And you still can't get a good daily woman now to clean, not for love or money.
Support your thyroid health by incorporating bladderwrack supplements into your daily routine.
words.defineEn: in a way that happens every day or once a day
words.defineVi: trong một cách mà xảy ra mỗi ngày hoặc một lần một ngày

examples: The master kept a weekly journal.
At precisely 6:45 a.m. the rowdiness ceases as Sailor, a union safety expert, takes the floor for his weekly lecture.
Including pulses in your weekly meal plan can help diversify your diet.
They have to obtain dribs and drabs from wherever they can, including charity, to make up their weekly income.
Average weekly benefits were about three hundred and eighty seven dollars nationwide.
words.defineEn: once a week; every week
words.defineVi: mỗi tuần một lần; mỗi tuần

examples: But my understanding is that most mortgages compound monthly.
Most collectors work on monthly quotas.
Monthly frequency is called ultra rapid cycling.
And then you have your monthlies.
This month I am bringing back monthly favourites.
words.defineEn: every month; once a month
words.defineVi: mỗi tháng; mỗi tháng một lần

examples: They're losing $200,000 on this deal, but that's chickenfeed to a company with yearly profits of $25 million.
Yearly flu shots aren’t so much boosters as whole new vaccines.
So yearly adjustment in the case that we're looking at.
Therefore, we're still learning a lot of new information yearly.
And so is getting your yearly checkup at the doctor!
words.defineEn: done once or every year
words.defineVi: thực hiện một lần hoặc mỗi năm

examples: He took up the reins of government immediately after the coup.
I immediately ordered a plate of Mediterranean busiate, which was prepared with artichoke and feta.
See your doctor immediately if you pass any blood.
She's wanted immediately in the director's office.
They hit it off immediately when they met at the party.
words.defineEn: in a way that is instant and involves no delay
words.defineVi: theo cách đó là ngay lập tức và không có sự chậm trễ

examples: Her recent conduct is beyond the pale.
Sales have lost steam in recent weeks.
The company's recent collapse has left their pension fund members up the creek.
The recent strike has put the airline company in a tight spot.
The most recent incident happened only a week ago.
words.defineEn: having happened, started, or been done only a short time ago
words.defineVi: đã xảy ra, bắt đầu, hoặc được thực hiện chỉ một thời gian ngắn trước đây

examples: I recently sold my bike.
The family has grown in size recently.
Recently, Mother Nature threw us a curveball in the form of a 50-degree day in the middle of January.
The gardens have recently been restored to their original glory.
We have clicked well together recently.
words.defineEn: at or during a time that is not long ago
words.defineVi: tại hoặc trong một thời gian không lâu trước đây

examples: Three players got their marching orders last week.
Company profits took a tumble last year.
Our cat produced kittens last week.
A wonder lasts but nine days.
That marriage won't last.
words.defineEn: final; happening at the end or coming after all others in order or time
words.defineVi: cuối cùng; xảy ra ở cuối hoặc đến sau tất cả những người khác theo thứ tự hoặc thời gian

examples: I'm taking the kids swimming later.
Three days later a rash appeared.
A few weeks later, I landed my dream job.
Please try again later.
The long arm of the law finally caught up with him 30 years later.
words.defineEn: at some point in the future; after the time mentioned
words.defineVi: tại một thời điểm nào đó trong tương lai; sau thời gian được đề cập

examples: The actress was practicing her lines before the audition.
Her life had always run smoothly before.
We have had these mysteries before.
Have you ever used this software before?
The case was tried before a jury.
words.defineEn: at an earlier time
words.defineVi: tại một thời điểm sớm hơn

examples: The bus came right on time.
The bus will arrive on time.
The train arrived at the platform right on time.
We'll get there on time.
The meeting finished on time, and everyone left the room.
words.defineEn: on a time that is supposed to
words.defineVi: vào một thời điểm được cho là

examples: Suddenly another soldier hits the dirt beside me.
My father died suddenly at the age of 48.
A man suddenly appeared from behind a tree.
Quite suddenly, her mind was made up.
Suddenly things started happening.
words.defineEn: quickly and unexpectedly
words.defineVi: một cách nhanh chóng và bất ngờ

examples: The organization supports various charitable causes through donations.
The increase had a ripple effect through the whole financial market.
The captain navigated the ship through rough waters with skill and expertise.
The train traveled through beautiful countryside.
The road continues through the village of Knightwick.
words.defineEn: up to and including; from start to finish; during and to the end of a period of time
words.defineVi: lên đến và bao gồm; từ bắt đầu đến kết thúc; trong và đến cuối một khoảng thời gian

examples: Yet, for the moment anyway, the bankers have lost their Midas touch.
Has your headache gone yet?
Has the postman been yet?
His parents have not yet reached retirement age.
Yet another candidate has thrown his hat into the ring.
words.defineEn: up to a particular point in time
words.defineVi: đến một thời điểm cụ thể

examples: He set the alarm for 7 a.m.
We didn't get to bed until 3 a.m.
At precisely 6:45 a.m. the rowdiness ceases as Sailor, a union safety expert, takes the floor for his weekly lecture.
We're open from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day.
The executive team touches base for 15 minutes every morning at 8:45 a.m. to raise any pressing issues.
words.defineEn: before noon; between midnight and noon
words.defineVi: trước buổi trưa; giữa nửa đêm và trưa

examples: Dinner is served between 7 and 10 p.m.
The store will close at 9 p.m. tonight.
The party started at 7 p.m., and it's getting on for 10 o'clock now.
The event starts at 7 p.m., and it's getting on now.
We're open from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day.
words.defineEn: after noon; between noon and midnight
words.defineVi: buổi chiều; giữa trưa và nửa đêm

examples: After all, one case of the trots hardly spells disaster.
Every age has its book, after all.
After all, love will find a way.
After all, an electrical brain is smarter than the sum of its parts.
A new broom sweeps clean, after all.
words.defineEn: at a later time
words.defineVi: sau đó

examples: The farmer employs modern agricultural techniques to maximize the yield of his soybean crop.
He worked in a modern office building with large windows.
These arguments provide the foundation for Simmel's account of the contradictory nature of modern life.
You actually like modern jazz, do you?
The French Revolution had a significant impact on shaping modern France.
words.defineEn: related to the most recent time or to the present time
words.defineVi: liên quan đến thời gian gần đây nhất hoặc đến thời điểm hiện tại

examples: The days passed slowly.
The time passed quickly.
The day and night passed slowly.
The feeling of sickness soon passed.
Unemployment has now passed the three million mark.
words.defineEn: (of time) to go by
words.defineVi: (của thời gian) trôi qua
